segments.text: I am sorry to trouble you again , Mr.Stone .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It's ok . What do you want to ask ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Where should I go after I arrived at the university ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: The first place you should go is the International Center .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You can get help there in dealing with the United States Immigration and Naturalization Service ; you can find Foreign Student Advisers .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What kind of role do foreign student advisers play ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: They'll discuss personal concerns , housing , adjustment , finances and other matters with you .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Can we get any more help at the International Center ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , a lot more . If you go there just before the beginning of the fall's semester , you can get your student ID and social security number there . They will keep your documents up-to-date . They will offer an orientation program for new comers . They will also help you contact your department and registration office .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I see . It must be worth going to .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Besides these , the center staff also works with community organizations which provide tours , home hospitality , speaking engagements and assistance for wives of foreign students . In cooperation with nationality clubs , student associations and other organizations , the International Center provides a varied program of cultural and social events throughout the year .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Wonderful . It is a home for foreign students .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It sure is . They also serve tea , coffee and refreshments . The Center staff members are also friendly and helpful . Everyone loves them .
segments.speaker: S2
